author_blurb.en: Translated for SuttaCentral by Sujato Bhikkhu

segments.pli: Aṅguttara Nikāya 7
2. Anusayavagga
16. Aniccānupassīsutta
“Sattime, bhikkhave, puggalā āhuneyyā pāhuneyyā dakkhiṇeyyā añjalikaraṇīyā anuttaraṃ puññakkhettaṃ lokassa.
segments.en: “Mendicants, there are seven people worthy of offerings dedicated to the gods, worthy of hospitality, worthy of a teacher’s offering, and worthy of greeting with joined palms. They are a supreme field of merit for the world.

segments.pli: Katame satta?
Idha, bhikkhave, ekacco puggalo sabbasaṅkhāresu aniccānupassī viharati, aniccasaññī, aniccapaṭisaṃvedī satataṃ samitaṃ abbokiṇṇaṃ cetasā adhimuccamāno paññāya pariyogāhamāno.
segments.en: First, take a person who meditates observing impermanence in all conditions. They perceive impermanence and experience impermanence. Constantly, continually, and without stopping, they apply the mind and fathom with wisdom.

segments.pli: So āsavānaṃ khayā … pe … sacchikatvā upasampajja viharati.
segments.en: They’ve realized the undefiled freedom of heart and freedom by wisdom in this very life, and live having realized it with their own insight due to the ending of defilements.

segments.pli: Ayaṃ, bhikkhave, paṭhamo puggalo āhuneyyo pāhuneyyo dakkhiṇeyyo añjalikaraṇīyo anuttaraṃ puññakkhettaṃ lokassa.
Puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, idhekacco puggalo sabbasaṅkhāresu aniccānupassī viharati, aniccasaññī, aniccapaṭisaṃvedī satataṃ samitaṃ abbokiṇṇaṃ cetasā adhimuccamāno paññāya pariyogāhamāno.
segments.en: Next, take a person who meditates observing impermanence in all conditions.

segments.pli: Tassa apubbaṃ acarimaṃ āsavapariyādānañca hoti jīvitapariyādānañca.
segments.en: Their defilements and their life come to an end at exactly the same time.

segments.pli: Ayaṃ, bhikkhave, dutiyo puggalo āhuneyyo … pe … anuttaraṃ puññakkhettaṃ lokassa.
Puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, idhekacco puggalo sabbasaṅkhāresu aniccānupassī viharati, aniccasaññī, aniccapaṭisaṃvedī satataṃ samitaṃ abbokiṇṇaṃ cetasā adhimuccamāno paññāya pariyogāhamāno.
segments.en: Next, take a person who meditates observing impermanence in all conditions.

segments.pli: So pañcannaṃ orambhāgiyānaṃ saṃyojanānaṃ parikkhayā antarāparinibbāyī hoti … pe …
segments.en: With the ending of the five lower fetters they’re extinguished in-between one life and the next. …

segments.pli: upahaccaparinibbāyī hoti … pe …
segments.en: With the ending of the five lower fetters they’re extinguished upon landing. …

segments.pli: asaṅkhāraparinibbāyī hoti … pe …
segments.en: With the ending of the five lower fetters they’re extinguished without extra effort. …

segments.pli: sasaṅkhāraparinibbāyī hoti … pe …
segments.en: With the ending of the five lower fetters they’re extinguished with extra effort. …

segments.pli: uddhaṃsoto hoti akaniṭṭhagāmī.
segments.en: With the ending of the five lower fetters they head upstream, going to the Akaniṭṭha realm.

segments.pli: Ayaṃ, bhikkhave, sattamo puggalo āhuneyyo pāhuneyyo dakkhiṇeyyo añjalikaraṇīyo anuttaraṃ puññakkhettaṃ lokassa.
Ime kho, bhikkhave, satta puggalā āhuneyyā pāhuneyyā dakkhiṇeyyā añjalikaraṇīyā anuttaraṃ puññakkhettaṃ lokassā”ti.
segments.en: These seven people are worthy of offerings dedicated to the gods, worthy of hospitality, worthy of a teacher’s offering, and worthy of greeting with joined palms. They are a supreme field of merit for the world.”

segments.pli: Chaṭṭhaṃ.

suttaplex.blurb: Seven persons who are worthy of gifts and veneration.
